issues.details: 20β€―nm polystyrene nanoplastics can penetrate humanβ€‘like skin, travel through lymph nodes, lungs, and liver within 4β€―weeks, and induce inflammatory and agingβ€‘related gene expression changes.

evaluations.opinion: ν”Όλ¶€λ¥Ό μ£Όμ” λ…Έμ¶ κ²½λ΅λ΅ ν¬ν•¨ν•΄μ•Ό ν•λ©°, μ¥κΈ°μ μΈ λ©΄μ—­Β·νΈν΅κΈ°Β·κ°„ λ…μ„± λ° λ€μ‚¬ μ΄μƒ κ°€λ¥μ„±μ„ μ‹μ‚¬ν•λ‹¤.

confirmed_facts: 20β€―nm polystyrene nanoplastics applied to mouse skin reached lymph nodes at 1β€―week, lungs at 3β€―weeks, and liver and blood at 4β€―weeks.
Threeβ€‘month repeated exposure increased inflammatory/aging genes (TNFβ€‘Ξ±, ILβ€‘6, MMPβ€‘3) by >2Γ— and altered expression of 294 genes up and 144 down.
Skin barrier function remained near normal while nanoplastics penetrated via pores and hair follicles.
unconfirmed_allegations: Nanoplastics cause accelerated aging in humans.
Nanoplastics directly induce organ toxicity in humans.
Nanoplastics pose an immediate widespread public health risk.

timeline.event: Study published in Journal of Hazardous Materials.
